I.R.:

* Iron Raptor almost didn�t hear Feline walk into the room and up to her, 
her mind too occupied with other matters to take notice of all that was 
around her.
She simply nodded at Feline�s report and to verify Prowls statement, knowing 
that Feline was in more need here then out in the field at the moment.
But, with her icy blue optics staring blankly at the projector behind Prowl 
and Kluster, she thought about the mission that she could no longer take 
part in. The mission to recover both Tavatron and Dinobot.
She would have to send a group of Maximals out to locate and bring back both 
of her missing bots, and to bring them back in whatever shape they may be 
in.
Iron Raptor thought about the team that she would send out when her thoughts 
were suddenly interrupted by her com-link, the sound of Firearms voice 
bringing her back to the present.
She shook her head for a moment to clear it, listening to Firearms request.
Her mind narrowed as she thought about both Hell Drak�s capture and Tavatron 
and Dinobot�s delayed return, and how Firearm requested troops for Hell 
Draks rescue mission.
There was something there in those two subjects that she could use, 
something that would get both missions done at almost the same time.
And she knew just what it was.
Iron Raptor opened her com-link to Firearm and spoke. *

� Request accepted, Firearm. Take five bots and bring this Hell Drak back to 
us. However�there�s also another mission I would like you and your group to 
run. A search and recover. On your way back, take a few bots and search Grid 
16 for any traces of two Maximal transformers that haven�t come back to us 
from a past mission. Their signatures have stopped there. Both Tavatron and 
Dinobots�. I want them found and brought back�no matter what condition you 
find them in. Alright?�

* She couldn�t help but speak with worry, it plain in her voice as she 
finished speaking.
In her mind she knew that they should have been back by now, even if one 
wasn�t able to make it the other would have brought them back safely.
But neither had shown any sign of return, and to her that spelled that both 
required help.
Iron Raptor deactivated her com-link and turned her blue optics towards 
Prowl, every bit of concern and worry reflecting within them. They were her 
Maximals�and something was wrong, she could feel it! And they were close 
enough to the Allaince that something else could go wrong, and she was 
almost expecting both of their signatures to fade from the scanners any 
moment. Lost, for reasons not yet known.
Iron Raptor then took her optics from Prowl, still knowing that there was 
also another thing that needed taking care of before she left for the 
Embassy.
She let out a concerned/frustrated sigh as her optics fell upon a framed 
schematic of the Cybertronian Fire on the far wall, slowly walking over to 
it and looking over it just as slowly. However, not really seeing it.
But this schematic also reminded her of that last task, one that was very 
important. The reconstruction of the Ark itself.
Iron Raptor places a hand on the wall before she turned slightly towards 
both Prowl and Kluster. *

� If either of you wouldn�t mind telling me: What�s the structural stasis of 
the Ark at the moment?�



Zyber:

* Zyber lowered her head so that she was looking right in the face of 
DeathScythes beast mode, looking for any signs of life at all.
Her eyes turned up to look at his massive chest, not moving a muscle and 
watching for just what she needed to know. His chest rose and fell, just 
what she wanted to see. He was breathing, and that was as good a sign as 
any.
Her eyes then turned back towards his face as her snout inched towards it, 
every muscle in her body ready to bolt if there were any sudden movements 
from this giant.
But there were none.
It was fairly obvious now that this bot was in stasis lock, something that 
was good as well as bad. It made him remain in beast mode which could help 
heal his wounds�as well as kill him if the repair was too slow. And it 
seemed here that it was all too slow.
But just to make sure that he wasn�t about to wake up Zyber heaved her own 
shoulder against his to see if there were any reactions.
There were none.
She lifted her head from the still form of DeathScythe and looked around 
her, finally turning her head in the direction that her den lay in. Oh, how 
she thought of it�s warm and inviting walls, of the fresh snow that would 
have fallen by now and painted her home world crystal white.
But when she looked back towards the fallen DeathScythe she knew that she 
had a task ahead of her, thinking of just how it would take her much more 
then a simple mega-cycle to get home now that she needed to get him there.
He was bigger then her and she knew he was heavier as well, but she had to 
get him to the safely of her den none the less.
Zyber took another step towards the fallen bot, then moving so that one of 
his front limbs was draped over her back. But, now came the hard part: With 
as much of her might as she had ever used, she wriggled under him so that 
now his torso lay slanted across her back and his head was draped over her 
shoulder. *
